page.title: 08BIRD LIFE
page.content: Our survey shows that the usual house sparrow, blackbird, robin, thrush and tits are the most often seen birds. Other birds observed regularly are dove, starling, wren, chaffinch, crow, greenfinch, and pigeon.{14%}of people mentioned the magpie, now a serious suburban resident, visit their garden. Summer visitors are the house martin nesting at{Coleham School}and spotted flycatcher. Heron are seen high over head flying westwards in the morning and returning in the evening to their heronry at{Longnor Hall, Atcham. An unusual sight in the winter is seeing the large{Meole Brace}traffic island populated with lapwing. One theory in the local press is that the pounding of traffic bring earth- worms to the surface and thus there is a steady supply of food. However, other theories have been suggested.
